﻿WEEK-END MX SPORTS cHIVER ALPES <s JURA C> ' SAMEDI ÉT DIMANCHE Os, LUNDI «ni»» PAPIERS PEINTS BOULEVARD HELVÉTIQUE, I» GENEVE D U M O N T BOULEVARD HELVETIQUE,19 EXTRAITS DE PRESSE He is undoubtedly one of the most talented among rising violonists. At his first récital he had readily disclosed in his possession the bright star oî promise. He was accredited at that time with excellent technical training, attractive tonal qualities and significant powers in penetrating below the surface of music he sought to interpret. Last evening he showed, without doubt, notable advancement in the weight and eloquence of his style. NetV-York. Mars 1935. Sun. The violinist’s technique was admirable, his tone full, his rhythmic sense excellent. New-York. Mars 1935. Brooklyn Daily Eagle.
